title: Jeff Lewis jokes he had 'to pull a Lori Loughlin' to get toddler daughter into new preschool
text:
His toddler daughter was expelled from her preschool after he made comments about other parents on his SiriusXM radio show.

But Jeff Lewis revealed this week he's found a place for Monroe at a new preschool.

However, the Flipping Out reality star shared with his listeners Tuesday, per People, that 'I did have to pull a Lori Loughlin and make a donation'.

Paid: Jeff Lewis said on his SiriusXM radio show this week that he 'had to pull a Lori Loughlin' to get his toddler daughter into a new preschool, referencing the college admissions scandal

Lewis was referring to the Full House star who is alleged to have paid $500,000 to get her daughters into the University of Southern California as part of a college admissions scam.

Lewis, 49, shares Monroe, who turns three later this month, with his ex Gage Edward, 35.

The tot was expelled from a Montessori preschool last month but has a place elsewhere after just a couple of weeks.

'Everyone is like, ‘How did you get her in school so quickly?’ and I’m like ‘I don’t know, I guess they just had a space!’ Well I sponsored the carnival, that’s how it happened,' he said.

Out: Monroe, two, was expelled from a Montessori pre-school last month after Lewis, 49, was accused of 'bullying' other parents and badmouthing a Back To School Night on his show

Donation: The Flipping Out reality star, who shares Monroe with his ex Gage Edward, said on air Tuesday he 'sponsored the carnival' in order to get her into a new preschool

In his September 17th radio show, Lewis said Monroe's expulsion came after her preschool's headmistress accused him of 'bullying' and mocking mothers of other students by reading their internal emails on the air and badmouthing their Back To School Night.

He said that Monroe's other father Edward — who he split from after a 10 year relationship — 'lost his s***' upon hearing about the situation.

'Gage was really, really upset,' he said. 'And he did yell at me and he did say some things that he probably regrets now.'

The couple split in February and were engaged in a heated custody battle until August when they reached a temporary agreement.

Indicted: Lori Loughlin and her husband Mossimo Giannulli, pictured leaving court in Boston on August 27, are currently awaiting trial as part of the college admissions scandal. They have denied the charges against them

Lori Loughlin, along with her husband Mossimo Giannulli, is currently awaiting trial on charges they paid to get their two daughters into USC as members of the crew team.

The couple have denied the charges against them.

Actress Felicity Huffman, who agreed to plead guilty to paying $15,000 to inflate her daughter's SAT scores, was sentenced on September 13 to 14 days in federal prison.

In total, 50 people nationwide have been indicted as part of the fraudulent scheme.
